text: Hey guys it's Ro welcome to another Nerdy Nummies
I got so many requests from you guys to make something from Guardians of the Galaxy
in honor of the new movie.
And that is exactly what we're going to be doing today
There was so many things I love about the first movie but one of the details I really loved
was Star-Lord's music mix cassette tape that he had.
It had a very special place in my heart warm and fuzzy because I grew up listening to cassette tapes
Let me know in the comments below if you even own a cassette tape or have ever owned it
They're pretty dated now but my first one was Ace of Base
*humming to 'I Saw a Sign'*
I digress. Anyways, let's get back to baking business
Today we are going to be making Star-Lord's mixtape cookies
Volume I and II; let's get started
The recipe that we're going to be making today is a chocolate sugar cookie recipe yum yum yum
The things you will need will be 2 and 3/4s cup of all-purpose flour
1 and a half cups of sugar
2 eggs
1 cup of unsalted butter
Half a cup plus two tablespoons of dark cooca powder
1 teaspoon of baking powder
1/8th a teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
and half a teaspoon of almond extract
Now let's put it all together
The first thing we're going to do in a medium sized bowl we're going to whisk together our dry ingredients
Flour, dark cocoa powder, baking powder and salt
Mix it up until it's well combined and then set it off to the side
Next cream together our butter and sugar until it's light and fluffy
I'm just going to be using a hand mixer at a medium speed
Add our eggs 1 at a time
So you're going to add an egg, mix it up, scrape down the sides, add the second egg
Add both of our extracts vanilla and almond
Sometimes I wish I was like Yondu and I could just whistle
*whistles*
And it would just *blending noise* all on its own
But I can't
We've got both of our mixtures, our wet and dry. Now add all of our dry into our wet
And mix together until it's well combined I'm going to start on the low speed so that we don't get a big dust cloud
And then work my way up to a medium
Dough is ready and now divide it I'm eyeballing it into two portions
Plop it here, I'm just going to shape it into a disc
And wrap it up tight in some plastic wrap
After you've wrapped your dough into little discs pop these in the refrigerator
to chill for about one hour.
The dough has chilled, now we're going to roll it out
Well that could've been worse
*whistles*
*evil snicker*
When you're making chocolate cookies and you've got a chocolate dough, instead of flour
to sprinkle over the surface you can actually use some dark cocoa powder
Pick up your dough place it right in the middle we're going to be rolling out the dough a quarter inch thick
and into a square shape
So we can fit as many cassette tapes as possible
[Southern belle accent] No officer I didn't eat all the brownies!
Time to cut out our cookies I found this really cool cassette cookie cutter online
I'll put a link down below if you're interested in getting it
Otherwise you can improvise, you can use what you have in the kitchen
The first shape is just a small rectangle and this is going to be the main shape of our cookie
These other little ones that I have over here are just for design details
So I'm going to cut out six of these, and then I'll re-roll my cookie dough and make some more
Now remove the excess cookie dough and transfer your cookies to a baking sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper
Use the additional cookie cutters to just put an imprint and make a cassette design
The first thing that we're going to do is indent the center of our tape with a smaller rectangle
leaving some room at the top, now I'm going to use this smaller trapezoid to make a detail at the bottom
Next with the smaller rectangle I'm going to indent the center of the tape
And I'm going to indent the viewer window
Now I'm going to cut out two round circles completely on each side of the small rectangle
Now I'm going to use a lollipop stick to indent the places where the machine would grab the tape
These cookies are almost ready to bake, first I'm going to pop them into the freezer for ten minutes to chill
It will help them keep their shape while they're baking
Then I'm going to heat my oven to 350 degrees and bake them for about twelve minutes
While our cookies are baking we are going to make some fondant decorations for the top of our cookies
We're going to make them look like tape labels
So that they look like the cassette from the movie
The things you'll need to decorate will be some
white fondant, I'm using marshmallow fondant,
some edible food markers colors blue and red
and a ruler
First thing I'm going to do is roll out my fondant
Using the two medium rectangle cookie cutters from my set I'm going to be cutting out first the larger one
and then cutting out the smaller one right in the middle
You won't need this middle piece, you can take him out
Now I'm going to let these shapes sit for about ten minutes to harden and I'm going to make a bunch more
Take your ruler you're going to line it up on top of your fondant
using the edge of the ruler, draw a straight line with my red edible marker pen
and fill it in
Using our blue edible marker write 'Awesome Mix Vol. 1' and 'Awesome Mix Vol. 2'
right on the top
All of the decorations are ready and our cookies have baked and had plenty of time to cool
and now for our final decoration step we're just going to assemble them together.
Take a little cassette cookie and a little bit of white royal icing I put some in a plastic baggie with a number 3 tip at the end
so we'd have a little bit more control.
Pipe some icing on the back then place it on the top
right there
Boom!
Then we're going to do this to the rest of our cookies
Ta-daaaaa!
Here are Star-Lord's cassette tape cookies that we made today
We made Awesome Mix Vol. 1 and Awesome Mix Vol. 2
I'll be taking lots of pictures and posting this chocolate sugar cookie recipe on
rosannapansino.com, Instagram, Facebook, and twitter you can check them out there
and if you guys make these cookies please take a picture and send it to me
I love seeing your baking creations it just makes me happy it makes my day
If you have any other ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies please let me know leave me a comment
down below and I will do my best to make it happen.
Alright, thanks again you guys I'm so excited for the new Guardians of the Galaxy, bye bye!
*silly singing*
*groans*
THIS IS REALLY GOOD!
